name: Lemon Tree Hotel, Ahmedabad

reviews.text: Wow, The staff had to be the most friendliest and accommodating people I have ever met! So kind & helpful! I had booked a hotel room for my parents who would be visiting me during my travels in Ahmedabad. I must admit I was initially quite dubious about this hotel as it was relatively new and there wasn’t much information available at the time of booking. I had purely booked it for its location. However, management allowed me to visit the hotel beforehand to ensure I was happy with the room and services provided which reassured me no end. I also requested an early check-in, which was instantly granted. The hotel was clean & the food was great! The room was spotless, spacious and had an especially nice shower with all necessities available. It was a calm retreat away from the busy hustle and bustle of city life, yet only a doorstep away. The quirky art deco around the hotel also brought a smile to my face. Above all, the food was more than adequate - especially for someone who isn’t used to the traditional spicy Indian menu. They catered for all tastes and we didn’t have to worry about the typical things a foreigner would when eating out in India.
reviews.title: A Citrus Delight

reviews.text: Expect a quality finish worth every penny you pay for.
reviews.title: Pleasent Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Best about Lemontree ahmedabad is they always say yes for everything you requires.
reviews.title: Ahmedabad's Best New Hotel

likes.liked: — It was brand new & therefore incredibly clean

reviews.title: great theme, no frills, simple but caters to all the needs of business travelers
reviews.text: i asked for early check in as i was arriving in ahmedabad at 5.30 am in early morning.my both rooms are ready with smile.even they have arranged dormitory place for my driver free of charge.

I am not sure where to start. With my wedding booked for June 2009 in North Carolina- USA, I had only one thing in mind- my trip to India for the fabulous wedding shopping. With originally only 3 nights booked online, my mom, sister, and I ended up staying 6 weeks in one room!
reviews.title: Best hotel for wedding shopping

reviews.text: From the first day we arrived to the last day, I had not only an excellent, safe, clean place to stay but felt like I was treated like a family member at the Lemon Tree-- the staff was exceptional!
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel in Ahmedabad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location was unbeatable-- you can catch an 'auto' to all the best places to shop, not to mention walk across the street to 'Shyamal and Bhumika' boutique. CG road was a hop, skip, and jump away. We made quick 'drop-offs' and 'bathroom breaks' at the hotel in the middle of the day-- 10 rupees to get anywhere from the hotel to all shops.
reviews.title: Smart new business hotel
Loved It
reviews.text: The breakfast(masala eggs, dosa, uttapam, and much more!) was a life savor! From the day I arrived in India, seven weeks later, neither one of us got sick. The hotel provided an excellent spread of hot breakfast and bottled water in your room every morning!
The Manager, Mr. Mahrotra, was always available to speak to and continued to check in on us consistantly throughout our stay.
reviews.title: Its Lemony!

likes.liked: — The freshness of the place and the staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the hotel for one night. Hotel building was not so nice from outside and communal area, however, room was quite nice.
reviews.title: Average hotel, do not expect too much

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were expecting to have good service, as this hotel was top hotel in the city. However, service was really INDIAN STANDARD. If you do not expect too much from the staff, this hotel is good, but if you want to have good service, it is not the one. This is always same problem in India, but staffs are not able to say 'NO'. Even they will not be able to do, they kept telling us 'Yes, yes, yes'
reviews.title: Totally Positive Experience
Smelly hotel, but restaurant is good
reviews.text: We had 3 meals at the hotel. And disappointed. It was just average. As hotel is located in the central, it is better to eat outside if you are not too tired.

reviews.title: Number one hotel? Not for me it wasnt.
reviews.text: We stayed one night in this new hotel. The staff were extra attentive and the room compact but comfortable - a very spacious marble shower stall deserves mention. The TV offered lots of English channels including BBC World and CNN for news. The restaurant food was excellent especially the buffet breakfast. We took away a packed lunch (toasted club and vegetarian sandwiches which included potato wedges) and it was delicious at lunchtime. We did not notice any smells although there was an ashtray and matches in our room. A very quiet location close to shopping malls as well. A far better room and restaurant than The Lemon Tree that we stayed at two years ago in Goa.

reviews.title: loved the location
reviews.text: the room is strong smelly with Lemon perfume, and the window is not allowed to open..... but anyway the restaurant with buffet dinner is good.

description: Located in Ahmedabad’s downtown shopping and commercial area of CG Road inNavrangpura, this attractive and airy hotel is walking distance from Hazira LNG,Adani House, Vadilal Industries, Suzlon Energy, HDFC Bank, Standard CharteredBank, Reliance Capital, Bank of Baroda and more.
